info.title: Time Deposit Contract
info.description:
A contract between a credit institute and customer, which is based on the customer's request for opening a bank account of type time deposit and consists among others, account holder, general terms and conditions.
You can use this API to read and update time deposit contracts.

Note:
The entity data model for time deposit contract represents the subtype Time Deposit Contract of a bank account contract. The model contains a subset of the attributes of the business object of time deposit Contract.

EDM Time Deposit Contract represents a bank account contract of BankAccountContractSubType 4 - Time Deposit Contract. The assumption is that many attributes are given by the production control (product) and are not display or changed in the assisted or unassisted channel for which this domain API is designed.

Remark:
The service Time Deposit Contract is assigned to service group Transactional Banking.

x-sap-shortText: Read, create, and update time deposit contracts using this synchronous inbound service

UUID.title: A UUID is a universal unique identifier of a bank account.
UUID.description: Remark: The BankAccountUUID is required for the performant read of a bank account related entity because BankAccountUUID corresponds to CONTRACT_INT which is part of the primary index of the database table. GDT: NOSC_UUID

com.sap.gateway.default.bankaccount.v000.title: Bank Account
com.sap.gateway.default.bankaccount.v000.description:
A Bank Account is an account that holds funds in a bank and is subject to deposits and withdrawals.Remark: 
 Filter: Only 'Eq' is supported as logical operator. 
 Integrity Conditions: 
 The following combinations of properties for filtering are allowed: 
 a.) by Bank Account ID 
 - ID (mandatory) 
 - CurrencyCode (optional) 
 - BankRoutingID (optional) 
 - BankCountryCode (optional) 
 No other filter attributes are allowed. 
 b.) by Bank Account Standard ID 
 - StandardID (mandatory) 
 - CurrencyCode (optional) 
 c.) by BankAccountContractUUID 
 - BankAccountContractUUID (mandatory) 
 d.) by Bank Account Contract ID 
 - BankAccountContractID (mandatory)

ID.title: Is an identifier of a bank account contract lock request.
ID.description:
Special characters like "-", "_", "*", "/" are not allowed.
Filter: Only 'Eq' is supported as logical operator.
Constraint: BankAccountContractUUID is not allowed as filter in case of cross-navigation (e.g. from Bank Account Contract Overview Retrieval). 
BDT: BankContractLockRequestID

com.sap.gateway.default.bankaccountcontr.title: Bank Account Contract Lock Request
com.sap.gateway.default.bankaccountcontr.description: A bank account contract lock request is a request to maintain locks on product features and transactions of bank account contract.Bank account contract is a view of a bank contract.

com.sap.gateway.default.bankaccountcontr.title: Bank Account Contract Cancel Request
com.sap.gateway.default.bankaccountcontr.description: A Bank Account Contract Cancel Request is a request from the account holder party to the bank to cancel a current account contract or a savings account contract immediately or at a future time.

com.sap.gateway.default.bacaccountholder.description: A Bank Account Contract Account Holder Change Request is a request to change the account holder of a current account contract or savings account contract or time deposit contract immediately.

ID.title: Identifies the bank account statement specification arrangement.
ID.description:
Use:
The ID is used to identify arrangements in a bank account statement specification that need to be updated.
GDT: BankAccountContractBankAccountStatementSpecificationArrangementID

BankContractCorrespondenceInstructionGro.title: A coded representation of a group of correspondence instructions related to a bank contract.
BankContractCorrespondenceInstructionGro.description:
Integrity Condition:
One or more correspondence specification instructions have to exist with this BankContractCorrespondenceInstructionGroupCode.
Use: The group can be used to send correspondence, depending on the group, to different correspondence recipients. In the group, one correspondence recipient receives the original and the other correspondence recipients receive duplicates.
GDT: BankContractCorrespondenceInstructionGroupCode

BankAccountStatementBindingIndicator.title: Indicates whether the bank account statement created by this arrangement is legally binding.
BankAccountStatementBindingIndicator.description:
Integrity Condition:
The BankAccountStatementBindingIndicator must be set for exactly one bank account statement arrangement.
GDT: Indicator

OnDemandAllowedIndicator.title: Indicates whether an on demand bank account statement is allowed for this bank account statement arrangement
OnDemandAllowedIndicator.description:
Integrity Condition:
The OnDemandAllowedIndicator can be set for one Bank account statement arrangement only.
Example:
The OnDemandAllowedIndicator is used for an arrangement in which the customer is able to print a bank account statement at a bank account statement printer.
GDT: Indicator

NoEntryBankAccountStatementCreateIndicat.title: Indicates whether a bank account statement is created even if there is no bank account entry for the given period.
NoEntryBankAccountStatementCreateIndicat.description:
Remark:
Relevant for payment entries and revenue expense entries.
GDT: Indicator

RecurrenceIndicator.title: Indicates whether the arrangement has a recurrence.
RecurrenceIndicator.description:
Integrity Condition:
If RecurrenceIndicator is true a Recurrence is available.
GDT: Indicator

RecurrenceMappableIndicator.title: Indicates that the recurrence for the arrangement is mappable.
RecurrenceMappableIndicator.description:
Integrity Condition:
If RecurrenceMappableIndicator is false no Recurrence is specified.
Remark:
The indicator is false if a recurrence is maintained in the system which cannot be mapped to Recurrence. An example is a monthly recurrence on 15th and 31st of a month.
GDT: Indicator

Recurrence.title: A specification of the repeated occurrence of a bank account statement creation within an arrangement of a bank account contract .
Recurrence.description:
Integrity Condition:
If RecurrenceIndicator is true and RecurrenceMappableIndicator is true Recurrence is specified.

BankAccountStatementSchedule.title: A schedule about creation of bank account statements.

Note:

Code.title: A coded representation of a balance based bank account entry restriction.

LimitAmount.title: Is an amount for a balance based bank account entry restriction that must not be exceeded.
LimitAmount.description:
Integrity Condition:
CurrencyCode of LimitAmount has to be equal to CurrencyCode of BankAccountContract.
GDT: Amount

PeriodDeterminationMethodCode.title: Is a coded representation of a type of a duration for a BankAccountEntryBalanceBasedRestriction in which the limit amount must not be exceeded.

Duration.title: Is period of time in which the limit amount must not be exceeded.
Duration.description:
Constraint: 
Allowed values for the period of time in duration are only years, months and days.
GDT: Duration

DurationStartMonth.title: Specifies the month in which the duration starts.
DurationStartMonth.description:
Integrity Condition: 
Month can only be specified, if PeriodDeterminationMethodCode is 5 and Duration is year.
GDT: Month

DurationStartDayOfMonth.title: Specifies the day in a month in the Gregorian calendar on which the duration starts.
DurationStartDayOfMonth.description:
Comment:
31 is equal to the last day of the month.
Integrity Condition:
Month can only be specified, if PeriodDeterminationMethodCode is 5 and Duration is year or month.
GDT: DayOfMonth

com.sap.gateway.default.timedepositcontr.title: Bank Account Entry Balance Based Restriction
com.sap.gateway.default.timedepositcontr.description:
A Bank Account Entry Balance Based Restriction restricts the creation of a bank account entry to the associated bank account based on a balance limit for a duration.
Remark:
If a bank account entry for the associated bank account is created, the system checks whether the balance of a bank account balance type exceeds the limit amount within the specified duration.
If the limit amount is exceeded, the creation of a bank account entry is forwarded to exception handling for a bank account entry.A balance-based bank account entry restriction can be used to prevent money laundering. For example, a restriction that allows a cumulative current of up to EUR 15,000 within any 30 day period can exist.

Month can only be specified, if PeriodDeterminationMethodCode is 5 and Duration is year or month.
GDT: DayOfMonth

com.sap.gateway.default.timedepositcontr.title: Bank Account Entry Balance Based Restriction (for update)
com.sap.gateway.default.timedepositcontr.description:
A Bank Account Entry Balance Based Restriction restricts the creation of a bank account entry to the associated bank account based on a balance limit for a duration.
Remark:
If a bank account entry for the associated bank account is created, the system checks whether the balance of a bank account balance type exceeds the limit amount within the specified duration.
If the limit amount is exceeded, the creation of a bank account entry is forwarded to exception handling for a bank account entry.A balance-based bank account entry restriction can be used to prevent money laundering. For example, a restriction that allows a cumulative current of up to EUR 15,000 within any 30 day period can exist.

Code.title: A coded representation of a statistic based bank account entry restriction.

BoundaryValue.title: is a value for a statistic based bank account entry restriction that must not be exceeded.
BoundaryValue.description:
Constraint: 
Only a positive value is allowed. Decimals are not allowed.
GDT: Value

PeriodDeterminationMethodCode.title: Is a coded representation of a type of a duration for a BankAccountEntryStatisticBasedRestriction in which the limit amount must not be exceeded.

Duration.title: Is period of time in which the limit amount must not be exceeded.
Duration.description:
Constraint: 
Allowed values for the period of time in duration are only years, months and days.
GDT: Duration

DurationStartMonth.title: Specifies the month in which the duration starts.
DurationStartMonth.description:
Integrity Condition: 
Month can only be specified, if PeriodDeterminationMethodCode is 5 and Duration is year.
GDT: Month

DurationStartDayOfMonth.title: Specifies the day in a month in the Gregorian calendar on which the duration starts.
DurationStartDayOfMonth.description:
Comment:
31 is equal to the last day of the month.
Integrity Condition:
Month can only be specified, if PeriodDeterminationMethodCode is 5 and Duration is year or month.
GDT: DayOfMonth

com.sap.gateway.default.timedepositcontr.title: Bank Account Entry Statistic Based Restriction
com.sap.gateway.default.timedepositcontr.description:
A Bank Account Entry Statistic Based Restriction restricts the creation of a bank account entry to the associated bank account based on a statistic limit for a duration.
Remark:
If a bank account entry for the associated bank account is created, the system checks whether the reading of a bank account statistic ID exceeds the boundary value within the specified duration.
If the boundary value is exceeded, the creation of a bank account entry is forwarded to exception handling for a bank account entry.
Example:
When a bank account statistic ID is a transaction counter a statistic based bank account entry restriction can be used to manage restraints on withdrawals.

Remark:

Remark:

ID.title: An identifier of a term agreement belonging to a deposit account contract.

StatusCode.title: A StatusCode is the coded representation of the status of a term agreement of a deposit account contract.

FixedAmountDeterminationMethodCode.title: A coded representation of the method to determine the fixed amount of a term agreement of a deposit account contract.
FixedAmountDeterminationMethodCode.description:
Constraint:
Only relevant for rollover agreements. For first agreement, can only be 'Planned Fixed Amount with Tolerance'.
GDT: BankAccountContractTermAgreementFixedAmountDeterminationMethodCode

FullyRepaidIndicator.title: Indicates whether the bank account balance has been fully repaid at the end of the fixing period.
FullyRepaidIndicator.description:
Constraint:
Only 'true' for term agreements with status code 3 - 'Called', which have been repaid because of setting for DefaultBankAccountContractTermAgreementRolloverTypeCode (3 - 'Full Repayment') or because of setting for FullRepaymentRequestedIndicator (true)
GDT: Indicator

FullRepaymentRequestedIndicator.title: Indicates whether the customer requests that the bank account balance is to be fully repaid at the end of the fixing period.
FullRepaymentRequestedIndicator.description:
Integrity condition:
The account holder can request a full repayment for a particular term agreement. If this is the case the DefaultBankAccountContractTermAgreementRolloverTypeCode is not used for this TermAgreement. 
GDT: Indicator

Amount.title: Amount is the amount that is defined for a term agreement.
Amount.description:
Integrity condition:
CurrencyCode of Amount has to be equal to CurrencyCode of TimeDepositContract. 
Integrity condition:
If FixedAmountDeterminationMethodCode is "Planned Fixed Amount with Tolerance" (value 1) Amount has to be provided else Amount must not be provided.
Constraint:
Amount has to be greater than zero.
Remark:
 If the status code is "Planned", the amount is planned. If the status code is "Fixed", the amount is fixed.
GDT: Amount

PlannedDifferenceAmount.title: The PlannedDifferenceAmount is the amount by which the fixed amount from the previous period is planned to be increased or decreased in the new term agreement.
PlannedDifferenceAmount.description:
Integrity condition:
 A planned difference amount is only allowed if there is another term agreement with a fixing period before the fixing period of this term agreement. 
PlannedDifferenceAmount must be provided if FixedAmountDeterminationMethodCode is "Increase Last Balance by Planned Fixed Amountwith Tolerance" (value 2) or "Reduce Last Balance by Planned Fixed Amount" (value 3) else PlannedDifferenceAmount must not be provided.
Constraint:
PlannedDifferenceAmount has to be greater than 0.
GDT: Amount

FixingDueDate.title: A FixingDueDate is the date on which the term agreement is due to be fixed.

FixingPeriod.title: A FixingPeriod is the period for which the amount is fixed.
FixingPeriod.description:
Remark:
If the status code is "planned", the fixing period is planned. If the status code is "fixed", the period is fixed.

InterestRateGuaranteedPeriod.title: A InterestRateGuaranteedPeriod is a period in which the interest rate conditions are guaranteed.
InterestRateGuaranteedPeriod.description:
Remark:
 If the actual start date of the fixing period for the term agreement is before the end date of the interest rate guaranteed period, the term agreement is based on the conditions (rates) valid during the interest rate guaranteed period.
If the actual start date of the fixing period for the term agreement is after the end date of the interest rate guaranteed period, the term agreement is based on the conditions (rates) valid at the actual start date of fixing period.

InterestEarnedPaymentInstructionCode.title: A coded representation of an instruction of how to handle the earned interest by a bank account contract within the fixing period.

EndOfTermInterestEarnedRepaymentRequired.title: Indicates whether the earned interest in total is required to be repaid at the end of term.
EndOfTermInterestEarnedRepaymentRequired.description:
Constraint:
 Can only be true in case of BankAccountContractInterestEarnedPaymentInstructionCode is 1 (Capitalize Interest Earned).
GDT: Indicator

MaturityCapitalYieldTaxCalculationRequir.title: Indicates whether capital yield tax is required to be calculated with the settlement at maturity.
MaturityCapitalYieldTaxCalculationRequir.description:
Constraint:
 Cannot be set to true if BankAccountContractInterestEarnedPaymentInstructionCode is 2 (Pay Out Interest Earned).
GDT: Indicator

FixingPeriodEndCorrespondenceCreationDat.title: The date on which the correspondence to inform the customer about the end of the fixing period of a term agreement is created.
FixingPeriodEndCorrespondenceCreationDat.description:
Remark:
The fixing period end correspondence creation date is determined from the end date of the fixing period minus the preliminary period for notice of maturity defined in the production control.
Remark:If the FixingPeriodEndCorrespondenceCreationRequestedIndicator is set, the system determines the maturity notice correspondence creation date.
GDT: Date

FixingPeriodEndCorrespondenceCreationReq.title: Indicates whether the creation of the correspondence is requested at the end of the fixing period of a term agreement.
FixingPeriodEndCorrespondenceCreationReq.description:
Remark:
 If this is set to true, the system fills the FixingPeriodEndCorrespondenceCreationDate.
GDT: Indicator

OriginCode.title: Indicates the origin of the term agreement.
OriginCode.description:
Remark:
Term Agreement can be created by the system based on DefaultBankAccountContractTermAgreementRolloverTypeCode or based on a customer request.
BDT: BankAccountContractTermAgreementOriginCode

GracePeriodEndDate.title: The end date of the grace period.
GracePeriodEndDate.description:
Remark:
Only applicable for term agreements that have been orgininated by a rollover.
GDT: Date

FixingPeriodEndCorrespondenceCreationReq.description:
Remark:
 If this is set to true, the system fills the FixingPeriodEndCorrespondenceCreationDate.
GDT: Indicator

OriginCode.title: Indicates the origin of the term agreement.
OriginCode.description:
Remark:
Term Agreement can be created by the system based on DefaultBankAccountContractTermAgreementRolloverTypeCode or based on a customer request.
BDT: BankAccountContractTermAgreementOriginCode

GracePeriodEndDate.title: The end date of the grace period.
GracePeriodEndDate.description:
Remark:
Only applicable for term agreements that have been orgininated by a rollover.
GDT: Date

com.sap.gateway.default.timedepositcontr.title: TermAgreement (for create)
com.sap.gateway.default.timedepositcontr.description: A TermAgreement is an agreement about the duration, amount, applicable conditions, and repayment request of the customer for a term within a deposit account contract. In this case, a term refers to a period of time.

StatusCode.title: A StatusCode is the coded representation of the status of a term agreement of a deposit account contract.

FixedAmountDeterminationMethodCode.title: A coded representation of the method to determine the fixed amount of a term agreement of a deposit account contract.
FixedAmountDeterminationMethodCode.description:
Constraint:
Only relevant for rollover agreements. For first agreement, can only be 'Planned Fixed Amount with Tolerance'.
GDT: BankAccountContractTermAgreementFixedAmountDeterminationMethodCode

FullyRepaidIndicator.title: Indicates whether the bank account balance has been fully repaid at the end of the fixing period.
FullyRepaidIndicator.description:
Constraint:
Only 'true' for term agreements with status code 3 - 'Called', which have been repaid because of setting for DefaultBankAccountContractTermAgreementRolloverTypeCode (3 - 'Full Repayment') or because of setting for FullRepaymentRequestedIndicator (true)
GDT: Indicator

FullRepaymentRequestedIndicator.title: Indicates whether the customer requests that the bank account balance is to be fully repaid at the end of the fixing period.
FullRepaymentRequestedIndicator.description:
Integrity condition:
The account holder can request a full repayment for a particular term agreement. If this is the case the DefaultBankAccountContractTermAgreementRolloverTypeCode is not used for this TermAgreement. 
GDT: Indicator

Amount.title: Amount is the amount that is defined for a term agreement.
Amount.description:
Integrity condition:
CurrencyCode of Amount has to be equal to CurrencyCode of TimeDepositContract. 
Integrity condition:
If FixedAmountDeterminationMethodCode is "Planned Fixed Amount with Tolerance" (value 1) Amount has to be provided else Amount must not be provided.
Constraint:
Amount has to be greater than zero.
Remark:
 If the status code is "Planned", the amount is planned. If the status code is "Fixed", the amount is fixed.
GDT: Amount

PlannedDifferenceAmount.title: The PlannedDifferenceAmount is the amount by which the fixed amount from the previous period is planned to be increased or decreased in the new term agreement.
PlannedDifferenceAmount.description:
Integrity condition:
 A planned difference amount is only allowed if there is another term agreement with a fixing period before the fixing period of this term agreement. 
PlannedDifferenceAmount must be provided if FixedAmountDeterminationMethodCode is "Increase Last Balance by Planned Fixed Amountwith Tolerance" (value 2) or "Reduce Last Balance by Planned Fixed Amount" (value 3) else PlannedDifferenceAmount must not be provided.
Constraint:
PlannedDifferenceAmount has to be greater than 0.
GDT: Amount

FixingDueDate.title: A FixingDueDate is the date on which the term agreement is due to be fixed.

FixingPeriod.title: A FixingPeriod is the period for which the amount is fixed.
FixingPeriod.description:
Remark:
If the status code is "planned", the fixing period is planned. If the status code is "fixed", the period is fixed.

InterestRateGuaranteedPeriod.title: A InterestRateGuaranteedPeriod is a period in which the interest rate conditions are guaranteed.
InterestRateGuaranteedPeriod.description:
Remark:
 If the actual start date of the fixing period for the term agreement is before the end date of the interest rate guaranteed period, the term agreement is based on the conditions (rates) valid during the interest rate guaranteed period.
If the actual start date of the fixing period for the term agreement is after the end date of the interest rate guaranteed period, the term agreement is based on the conditions (rates) valid at the actual start date of fixing period.

InterestEarnedPaymentInstructionCode.title: A coded representation of an instruction of how to handle the earned interest by a bank account contract within the fixing period.

EndOfTermInterestEarnedRepaymentRequired.title: Indicates whether the earned interest in total is required to be repaid at the end of term.
EndOfTermInterestEarnedRepaymentRequired.description:
Constraint:
 Can only be true in case of BankAccountContractInterestEarnedPaymentInstructionCode is 1 (Capitalize Interest Earned).
GDT: Indicator

MaturityCapitalYieldTaxCalculationRequir.title: Indicates whether capital yield tax is required to be calculated with the settlement at maturity.
MaturityCapitalYieldTaxCalculationRequir.description:
Constraint:
 Cannot be set to true if BankAccountContractInterestEarnedPaymentInstructionCode is 2 (Pay Out Interest Earned).
GDT: Indicator

FixingPeriodEndCorrespondenceCreationDat.title: The date on which the correspondence to inform the customer about the end of the fixing period of a term agreement is created.
FixingPeriodEndCorrespondenceCreationDat.description:
Remark:
The fixing period end correspondence creation date is determined from the end date of the fixing period minus the preliminary period for notice of maturity defined in the production control.
Remark:If the FixingPeriodEndCorrespondenceCreationRequestedIndicator is set, the system determines the maturity notice correspondence creation date.
GDT: Date

FixingPeriodEndCorrespondenceCreationReq.title: Indicates whether the creation of the correspondence is requested at the end of the fixing period of a term agreement.
FixingPeriodEndCorrespondenceCreationReq.description:
Remark:
 If this is set to true, the system fills the FixingPeriodEndCorrespondenceCreationDate.
GDT: Indicator

OriginCode.title: Indicates the origin of the term agreement.
OriginCode.description:
Remark:
Term Agreement can be created by the system based on DefaultBankAccountContractTermAgreementRolloverTypeCode or based on a customer request.
BDT: BankAccountContractTermAgreementOriginCode

GracePeriodEndDate.title: The end date of the grace period.
GracePeriodEndDate.description:
Remark:
Only applicable for term agreements that have been orgininated by a rollover.
GDT: Date

FrequencyCode.title:
A FrequencyCode specifies the frequency of the recurrence as a code.
Constraint: Only codes 4 (Daily), 5 (Weekly), 6 (Monthly) and 7 (Yearly) are supported.Integrity Condition: In case of FrequencyCode 5 (Weekly) WeekdayCode has to be specified, in case of FrequencyCode 6 (Monthly) DayOfMonth has to be specified, n case of FrequencyCode 7 (Yearly) DayOfMonth and Month have to be specified.

FrequencyValue.title: FrequencyValue specifies the number of units derived from the frequency codes that lie between two occurrences.

WeekdayCode.title:
A coded representation of a day in a week.
Use: The WeekdayCode is used to identify a single day in a week. For example to set the first day of a week.

Month.title: Month specifies the month in which a recurrence takes place.

DayOfMonth.title: DayOfMonth specifies the day in a month in the Gregorian calendar on which a recurrence takes place. 31 is equal to the last day of the month.

KeyDateWorkingDayAdjustmentRuleCode.title: A KeyDateWorkingDayAdjustmentRuleCode specifies the rule for adjusting a given key date to a working day.

TermPhaseCode.title: A coded representation of the phase of the term specification based on the individual status codes of related term agreements belonging to the deposit account contract.

DefaultTermAgreementRolloverTypeCode.title: A coded representation of the type of rollover for a completed term agreement of a deposit account contract that is designated as default.
DefaultTermAgreementRolloverTypeCode.description:
Remark: It will be taken into account by the credit institute at the end of the fixing period of a term agreement if no planned term agreement exists.
Constraint: The code value 2 'Increased Rollover'is not allowed.
GDT: BankAccountContractTermPhaseCode

ReferenceInterestCurveCode.title: A ReferenceInterestCurveCode is the coded representation of the description of a reference interest curve. The reference interest curve serves as a guideline for the amount when determining which contractual interest rate is used for a financial condition.
